channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: @fxshaw my brain isn't working this morning. the fog is thick. ;-)

Here's the result of getting a tweet containing a Wordle report, when retrieved via the Twitter API. https://t.co/gh2sPrnlZn Note that the text of the tweet appears to be mangled. Trying to figure out how to get this via the API... https://t.co/zyctBh1NM5
Wordle 316 5/6 â¬œâ¬œâ¬œâ¬œâ¬œ â¬œðŸŸ©â¬œâ¬œâ¬œ â¬œâ¬œâ¬œðŸŸ¨â¬œ â¬œðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©â¬œâ¬œ ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©ðŸŸ©

@marcedavis Also there was the perfect opportunity to do so, when government officials started posting official documents to @medium. Even the then-president, Obama, did it as did the Speaker of the House. That should not have been allowed.
@marcedavis @Medium Also the Library of Congress started archiving tweets. Ridiculous. Another clear signal that something bigger was called for.

My tweets for April are automatically archived in JSON, in case someday I want to read them into a database and use them in some way. I can leave notes to the future in this manner. Here's the JSON. https://t.co/COmgUrildB

Why isn't something like this thread amplified in the form of a commercial that runs on CNN, MSNBC and Fox every night until Congress acts? When are we going to organize some of the energy here or are we all just going to be screaming in pain at each other. https://t.co/tudbSI8Ge3
Also, to the tech industry - why can't we help the doctor do a more effective form of presentation than this crappy thread structure?
@jack is busy inventing ponzi schemes to increase his net worth of billions by a few points every year.
Why not do something good w your money?
Also, to the tech industry - why can't we help the doctor do a more effective form of presentation than this crappy thread structure?
Scientists blast out Earthâ€™s location with the hope of reaching aliens. https://t.co/s3F4Qolrsr
